dal.domain.row
Class PrescriptionRow

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.netspective.sparx.xif.dal.AbstractRow
        |
        +--dal.domain.row.PrescriptionRow
All Implemented Interfaces:
Prescription, Row
public class PrescriptionRow
extends AbstractRow
implements Prescription

Represents a single row of the Prescription table.

Some relevant facts about this class:

  • It represents the data that can be stored and retrieved from the Prescription table in the database.
  • The row is a child of the Person table in the database.
  • It has 11 columns, all of which have getter and setter methods.
  • It has 4 columns that reference Enumeration tables, all of which have special getter and setter methods to help prevent database joins for obtaining simple lookup values:
    1. getRecordStatusIdEnum() and setRecordStatusId(dal.table.RecordStatusTable.EnumeratedItem)
    2. getDrugEnum() and setDrug(dal.table.DrugTypeTable.EnumeratedItem)
    3. getDosageEnum() and setDosage(dal.table.DosageTypeTable.EnumeratedItem)
    4. getQuantityEnum() and setQuantity(dal.table.QuantityTypeTable.EnumeratedItem)

getData

public java.lang.Object[] getData()
Description copied from interface: Row
Returns an array that contains the current values of each of the columns in the Row. The columns are ordered in the same order as the original definition of the table.
Overrides:
getData in class AbstractRow

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object row)
Return true if the row is an instance of the PrescriptionRow class and each of the columns in the row parameter matches the data contained in this row. The values of two columns are considered equal when either the object is the same, both are null, or the equals() method for the two objects when compared with other returns true.
Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object

getDataForDmlStatement

public java.util.List getDataForDmlStatement()
Description copied from interface: Row
Returns a List that of the current values of each of the columns in the Row. This list is suitable for passing into the DmlStatement object.
Overrides:
getDataForDmlStatement in class AbstractRow

populateDataByIndexes

public void populateDataByIndexes(java.sql.ResultSet rs)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
Description copied from interface: Row
Given a ResultSet, populate the values of the Row with the values provided in the ResultSet. This method assumes that the ResultSet columns are ordered in the same manner as when the table was defined and is almost always used to populate a Row when the ResultSet contains all the columns that are defined for a particular table.
Overrides:
populateDataByIndexes in class AbstractRow

populateDataByNames

public void populateDataByNames(java.sql.ResultSet rs,
                                java.util.Map colNameIndexMap)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
Description copied from interface: Row
Given a ResultSet, populate the values with the columns indexed in the manner specified by the colNameIndexMap. Each entry in the colNameIndexMap supplies a lower-cased column name as the map key and the column index number in the ResultSet as the map key's value. If colNameIndexMap is null, then this method automatically creates a map that is created by reading the ResultSetMetaData for the resultSet. If a column of the Row is not found in the ResultSet, it's value is left unchanged. This allows multiple calls to this method and the latest change is the change that will remain.
Overrides:
populateDataByNames in class AbstractRow

populateDataByNames

public void populateDataByNames(org.w3c.dom.Element element)
                         throws java.text.ParseException,
                                org.w3c.dom.DOMException
Description copied from interface: Row
Given an XML element that contains column data, extract each column and assign it to the appropriate data variable. The main element must follow this DTD (the element parameter in the method call is considered the "row" element):
Overrides:
populateDataByNames in class AbstractRow

populateDataByNames

public void populateDataByNames(DialogContext dc)
Description copied from interface: Row
Given a DialogContext, populate the Row's column values with the values of the fields in the DialogContext that match the names of the columns. For each column in the Row, if a matching field value is not found, the value of the column will remain unchanged.
Overrides:
populateDataByNames in class AbstractRow

populateDataByNames

public void populateDataByNames(DialogContext dc,
                                java.util.Map colNameFieldNameMap)
Description copied from interface: Row
Given a DialogContext, populate the Row's column values with the values of the fields in the DialogContext that match the names of the columns. For each column in the Row, the colNameFieldNameMap is checked for the mapping of a column name to a field name. If a matching field name is found in the map, it is used. If a matching name is not found in the map, then a field name the same as the column name will be located. In the colNameFieldNameMap, the key is the column name and the value of the key is the name of field that column's value comes from. If no matching column is found either in the map or the regular field name, the column's current value is maintained.
Overrides:
populateDataByNames in class AbstractRow

setData

public void setData(DialogContext dc)
Description copied from interface: Row
Given a DialogContext, populate the DialogContext's field values with the Row's column values that match the names of the columns. If no matching field is found for any given column, that column's value is ignored.
Overrides:
setData in class AbstractRow

setData

public void setData(DialogContext dc,
                    java.util.Map colNameFieldNameMap)
Description copied from interface: Row
Given a DialogContext, populate the DialogContext's field values with the Row's column values that match the names of the columns specified in the colNameFieldNamesMap. If a matching name is not found in the map, then a field name the same as the column name will be located. In the colNameFieldNameMap, the key is the column name and the value of the key is the name of field that column's value goes to. If no matching field is found for any given column, that column's value is ignored.
Overrides:
setData in class AbstractRow
